metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5202 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
browser/extensions/api/dial/dial_registry.cc in Google Chrome before 54.0.2840.98 on macOS, before 54.0.2840.99 on Windows, and before 54.0.2840.100 on Linux neglects to copy a device ID before an erase() call, which causes the erase operation to access data that that erase operation will destroy.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5202` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.18.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.18.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.18.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.18.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.18.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.18.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.18.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.18.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
